Blog.post: urlLink Fellowship would like to wish Keilah Kitching a Happy Birthday! May God continue to bless her and the Kitching family throughout the years. "Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it." Proverbs 22:6

urlLink Fellowship would like to personally thank all those who have recently accepted their invitations to our blog site. We are happy to see that our community is growing! Thought for the day: I know many of you are probably tired and it feels like all of your energy is being taken up. We all work during the week, whether it be at our careers or at our families. It is still work. And I know we look forward to that sabbath rest, but don't forget that everyday should be a day of renewing our strengths. Tap into the spring of the "living water"! May God be with you throughout the rest of the week.

urlLink Fellowship would like to ask all of our members to keep Kathy Kitching in your prayers. We want to pray for her family and career. If anyone has a prayer request let us know. We will include you in our prayer circle as well as in the next issue of Fellowship. May God continue to bless you.

It feels so good to finally enjoy the nice weather. Mother nature is now alive! As the seasons change it feels so natural to change with time. Walking with God is like a beauty regimen. Each day you have to exfoliate to keep fresh. Exfoliating in a beauty routine is to remove dull, dead skin cells to instantly reveal smooth, healthy skin. As a notice the spring I also noticed I have been starting over(spiritually,professionally) This is a daily routine to keep me motivated and radiant. May peace fill your hearts.

I would like to thank all those who have signed up. We're still waiting on other members of Fellowship that have been invited. In the mean time feel free to get your profiles set up. Get used to the program. Talk to you soon.

urlLink Hello Fellowship Members, welcome to the Fellowship's Blog page. Here you can post comments or talk about topics that involve our newsletter. You can also speak to other members and stay posted on calendar events. Feel free to post ideas, events, and birthdays that you would like to include in our calendar or newsletter. May God continue to bless you.

urlLink Boston 4th of July Celebration! Date & Time: 07/04/2004 Noon - Evening Location: Boston Esplanade, Depart from Atlantic Union College Men's Residence at noon. Event Host: Wildo Itinerary Details: 1. Meet at and depart from AUC Men's Dorm at noon. 2. Arrive at Esplanade, settle down after finding a good spot. 3. Enjoy the surroundings, the music, the food, the people, and oh yes, the fireworks! Price: Bring about $5 for parking and about $3 per person for the subway. You may also want to bring additional cash if you want to buy food or ice-cream from the vendors. Important Notes: 1. If you happen to be uncomfortable within a large group of people, you may want to re-consider your participation in this event. Typically, immediately following the fireworks, everyone and their mother wants to take off at the same time. This translates into large crowds and sometimes some light pushing and mild shoving. So again, if you are uncomfortable in this type of situation, you've been fore warned. 2. Consider what you are planning to bring and carry with you that day. Remember that you will be on the subway for part of the journey. Things You May Want to Bring: 1. Food, snacks, drinks, perhaps a small cooler. 2. Blanket, beach towel, or mat where you can sit or lie down. 3. Money: parking, subway, vendors. 4. Cell-phone 5. A fun attitude. Directions: From Alewife - Take the Redline Train to the "Charles/MGH" stop. Alewife Parking Garage and Subway Station 1 Cambridgepark Dr. Cambridge, MA 02140-2309 For additional information on this event please contact Wildo at wballenilla@earthlink.net

urlLink Fellowship is looking for YOU!! The deadline is almost near. June 22nd. If you have or have been thinking of something to contribute to next months issue then don't hesitate to send it in. Fellowship also has its own email address, so now you can send all entries to fellowship4@verizon.net. And remember if you don't see your piece in next month's issue it will definetly be used in the upcoming ones. Thank you and God bless.

urlLink There was a want ad on this months newsletter and we would like to say that the position has now been filled. Fellowship is happy to announce that one of our members took an interest in helping out and taking on the responsibility of organizing our calendar and events. Our new Events Coordinator is (drum roll please....) Wildo Ballenilla. Thank you Wildo. For those who had an interest or thought about the position, it does not mean that you can not share your ideas with us. Just let Fellowship know what you would like to see in the future and we and our Event Coordinator will put something together for all to enjoy. God Bless you!! P.S. The Lord takes care of his people!

Denys, I would like to dedicate this letter or posting to you. I think you have been such a hard worker in bringing all these tips to stay on fire for GOD! i felt inspired today to inform you that GOD is pleased, and so are we. You are so creative and you've been an inspration and a positive sister. May you understand your power and the messages you share only adds jewls to your crown. "reach people through your acts of kindness" Thank you! I would like to suggest the next book. The Purpose Driven Life by: Rick Warren this is a self help book. zyhre difference between this book and the rest is all the other books tell you to find your purpose within your self, but this book tells you search your creator, and his reason for creating you. It helps you understand God's plan for you! It's a fourty-day journey, but it know to change lifes. One love, and may peace be in your heart. Rose-Laure

urlLink Hello Everyone. I hope everyone has recieved their copy of Fellowship this week. We're back on track now. This months issue was a little short, but I know that with the last month we had off many of you can now continue to send in your pieces. If there are any question or concerns please contact us at dmota@verizon.net. God Bless.
